meanings.definition: Too friendly or intimate; excessively familiar.
meanings.sent1: She became overfamiliar with her new classmates too quickly.
meanings.sent2: It's not good to be overfamiliar with strangers you just met.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's overfamiliar behavior towards the cat made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His overfamiliar attitude towards authority figures got him into trouble.
meanings.sent5: The overfamiliar salesman made customers uncomfortable with his constant jokes.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of proper respect or formality.
meanings.sent1: His overfamiliar tone with the principal was inappropriate.
meanings.sent2: The employee's overfamiliar behavior towards the CEO was frowned upon.
meanings.sent3: The overfamiliar waiter kept joking with the customers, crossing the line.
meanings.sent4: The overfamiliar attitude of the student towards the teacher was unacceptable.
meanings.sent5: The overfamiliar email from the intern to the CEO raised eyebrows in the office.
